data.title: GeoMundus Conference – November 7–8, 2014 – Münster, Germany
data.meta_description: GeoMundus Conference. GeoMundus is a symposium held by the students from the consortium of Erasmus Mundus (EM) International Master's program in Geospatial Technologies. Taking place November 7th to 8th, 2014 in Münster, Germany. Organized by students of UJI, WWU, UNL and for students.
data.text:
On this page you'll find the information about the venues for the conference and for the workshops. We're working on an attendee PDF pack as well. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us.

The conference will take place in the "Institute for Geoinformatics (ifgi)," in University of Münster.

Hotels

Looking For Accommodation?

If you'd like to join the GeoMundus crew staying at HOTEL, we've secured a special rate of $219 + taxes for our attendees! The rate is valid for 6th, 7th and 8th November 2014. Rooms must be booked by the cut off date September 30th 2014.

If you'd like to make a reservation, just use this link, or call *** and quote GeoMundus Accommodation. Rooms at this rate are limited, so please don't delay!

Mercure Hotel Münster City 4*

Things To Do In Münster

If you're one of our many lovely attendees traveling to Münster from out of town, then of course, you'll be wanting to make the most of your time in this amazing city! For decades, creative types have flocked to Münster to get inspired by its unrivalled energy and vibrance. We hope that you'll leave the GeoMundus Conf with your brain buzzing, not only from all of our incredible speakers, but from being immersed in such fantastic surroundings. Here are a few ideas of stuff to check out while you're in town.

LWL-Museum für Kunst & Kultur

Domplatz 10

D-48149 Münster

Pricing: € 3.50

Since its foundation in 1908 the Provincial Museum has been the centre for fine arts in Westphalia. It presents over a thousand years of art history, from the Middle Ages to modern times.

Website

Kunstmuseum Pablo Picasso

Picassoplatz 1

D-48149 Münster

Pricing: € 10.00

With over 780 lithographs, it houses a collection which is unique in the world, and which was further supplemented by a hundred etchings with the purchase of the "Suite Vollard" in Nov 2001.

Website

Stadtmuseum

Münster

Salzstrasse 28

D-48149 Münster

Pricing: free

The outline of the exhibition is provided by numerous models of the city and its architecture, which illustrate Münster's changing shape from the foundation of the city until now.

Website

Friedenssaal

(Peace Hall)

Prinzipalmarkt 10

D-48149 Münster

Pricing: € 2.00

The Peace Hall in Münster's gothic town hall owes its name to the peace treaty between Spain and the Netherlands, which was concluded here under solemn oath at 1648.

Website
